li.text: For any changed settings to take effect the game must be restarted.
Removes the action of eating random things for curiosity from animal AI logic trees.

Removes the action of mining through walls and rock to escape when hungry from animal AI logic trees. Instead they will now just starve to death.\nNote: This does not apply to Alpha Animals creatures who use the Animal Digger logic tree since they are designed to dig through things.
Removes the allowedBiomes tag on the Herd Migration event so it can trigger on any biome.
Adds breeding pairs of Horses always for sale at Neolithic and Medieval bases so you have an easy way to get caravan animals.
Allows wild animals to mate so they become pregnant just like colony animals. Also removes the deterioration rate of fertilized eggs so they can survive outdoors.

Changes the FilthRate to 1, Wildness to 0, Petness to 1, nuzzleMtbHours to 12, removes the manhunter on failed taming chance and adds the Special Trainable Comfort. This puts them on par with dogs allowing you to have clean, friendly, nuzzle happy wolves. Also adds mating pairs of Timber Wolves and Arctic Wolves for sale at faction bases so they're easy to acquire.
Adds a number of new categories for drugs and organises items so they can be more easily accessed. The following categories are added, Hard, Medical, Social.

Adds a number of new categories for food and organises items so they can be more easily accessed. The following categories are added, Awful, Simple, Fine, Lavish, Gourmet (VCE), Confectionery (VCE), Long Term, Jelly (Alpha Animals), Milk (Alpha Animals), Raw Tasty, Baby Food (Biotech DLC), Animal Feed, Gluttonous, Blood (Biotech DLC), Cocktails (VBE).

Warning: Due to changing item categories this tweak can interfere with stacking mods that rely on categories. For OgreStack this causes the items to be classed under Other instead of their default categories. If you use more specific stacking settings be sure to account for this.

Changes every ThingDef to remove the defaultStorageSettings and changes the default priority to normal. Unlike the mod No Default Shelf Storage which intentionally looks for a ThingClass to target only storage items this patch goes for everything. This means it'll target things like Mortars, Sarcophaguses, Biosculpters, Growth Pods and more.
Changes rock and slag chunks to be stacklable and allows you to customise the stack limit.
Warning: If enabled midsave this option may cause all rock and slag chunks to vanish.
Input values to adjust the stack limit.

Removes the food poisoning chance from all RawTasty foods and all Gluttonous items that have the ParentDef OrganicProductBase. Foods that use RawTasty are things like Berries, Milk and modded items such as Fruits. Gluttonous items that have the ParentDef OrganicProductBase are things such as Insect Jelly and modded items such as Honey.

Changes the preferability of Insect Jelly from Fine Meal to Raw Tasty. This means pawns will only prefer it as food if there are no cooked meals. However, they will still eat it for Gluttonous Recreation. This allows you to easier keep your expensive jelly for sale and recreation.

Changes long term foods like Pemmican and Packaged Survival Meals to be less desirable than normal meals.\nNote: Distance seems to be factored into food choice so for best results long term foods should be stored near other meals.
Warning: This tweak may cause friendlies to pilfer your food supplies more as their preserved meals are considered less desirable.
Adds Raw Fungus to the list of default disallowed ingredients on meals.
Allows you to set a maximum radius pawns will search for a table when consuming ingestible items. This patches all items with a preferability except ones with NeverForNutrition.

Input a value to set a maximum radius pawns will search for a table when consuming ingestible items. This patches all items with a preferability except ones with NeverForNutrition.\nNote: If a table is within this radius they will go to it before consuming items so be careful not to set it too high. The default value of 75 is what I've found to be a nice middle ground.

Replaces the mechanoid disassembly returns with accurate resources based on the resources required for gestating them. It also allows tweaking of the disassembly efficiency stat so the returns can be scaled down while remaining accurate. To prevent excess resources Mechanoid Slag Chunk drops are removed from all mechanoids.

Input a value to adjust the efficiency stats for Mechanoid Disassembly. The Base stat is the starting efficiency percentage before factoring in manipulation, eyesight and crafting skill while the Max stat is the maximum percentage of resources acquirable.\nVanilla (0.75, 1).

li.label: Disable Mechanoid Subcores from disassembly loot.

li.text: Changes turrets to be rearmed even if they are 99% full of ammo.
Allows you to customise how furniture quality effects the Bed Rest Effectiveness stat.
Move the slider to adjust the Bed Rest Effectiveness stat for that particular quality.\nVanilla (0.86, 0.92, 1.00, 1.08, 1.14, 1.25, 1.60).
Allows you to individually enable options that will add or change things in the quest reward pool.

li.label: Adds Hyperweave as a filler material.
Adds Jade as a filler material.
Adds Synthread as a filler material.

li.text: Changes the layering of a large number of utility items so they can be worn together. For instance, many items are moved to the Torso, Lances are moved to the Shoulders, Orbital items are moved to the Legs. This change does not cause issues for clothing/armour since all items are on the Utility layer which is normally unused except for Waist. This tweak also includes a patch to change all Utility items to not count as clothing for nudists in the event they are not tagged correctly.
Allows you to customise how large rivers appear on maps.
Input a value to adjust the size of rivers.\nVanilla values (30, 14, 6, 4).
Allows pawns to chat on the Comms Console to gain Social Recreation and Social Experience.

Changes the Global Learning Speed stat to be affected by consciousness. This makes it so people with brain injuries learn slower while those with increased consciousness from bionics or drugs learn faster.
Changes the default colour of electric lights to be White.
Allows ancient dangers to spawn on encounter maps.
Allows resources and deep drilling veins to spawn on encounter maps again.
Reduces the crafting time of Components and Advanced Components to 1/4. Also adds bulk recipes for crafting 5x 10x 25x and 50x.
Allows you to customise the speed of Moisture Pumps.
Input values to adjust the speed and radius of Moisture Pumps. The speed value is written in days.\nThe Vanilla value is 60 (1 year).

li.label: Filth Vanishes With Rain And Time

li.text: Changes all filth types so they disappear within 14-15 days and wash away with rain/snow. See the Filth Vanishes With Rain And Time workshop page for full details.

li.label: Allow Gray Flesh trails to wash away with rain/snow.

li.text: Warning: This will make Metalhorrors more dangerous during bad weather as their traces will disappear almost immediately.

li.label: Allow Revenant blood and trails to wash away with rain/snow.

li.text: Warning: This will make Revenants significantly more dangerous during bad weather as their traces will disappear almost immediately making them impossible to track.
Doubles the selection weight of Drop Pod raid strategies. Also removes the raid point scaling so drop pod raids are the same size as normal raids.

Modifies the duration of Environmental Events and increases the refire interval somewhat to compensate. This makes events overall harder as they last longer.\n\nCold Snap and Heat Wave x2 Duration, Toxic Fallout x4 Duration, Volcanic Winter x2.5 Min and x1.5 Max Duration, Blood Rain x4.5 Min and x2 Max Duration (Anomaly DLC), Death Pall x2 Duration (Anomaly DLC), Volcanic Ash x1.5 Min and x1.75 Max Duration (Odyssey DLC), Drought x1.67 Min and x1.5 Max Duration (Odyssey DLC), Gill Rot x2.34 Min and x2.5 Max Duration (Odyssey DLC), Drought (Vanilla Events Expanded) x1.7 Min and x3 Max Duration.
Makes power conduits immortal, they have no health and can't catch fire.

Changes linkables to have a maximum connection distance of 50 tiles, removes the line of sight requirement and removes the must be placed adjacent requirement.\nNote: The adjacent change is only for certain linkables like Vitals Monitors.
Removes the restriction on everything so interaction spots can overlap. The interaction spot is where a pawn stands while using the building and typically where you place a seat for them.
Allows you to customise the flammability stat of each metal. You can make things less or more flammable or completely immune to fire.

Input a value to adjust the flammability of each metal. The lower the number the less flammable it is. The displayed number is a percentage of its flammability. Setting it to 0 will make that metal completely immune to fire.\nVanilla flammability is 0.4 (40%).
Allows you to customise how frequently quests appear.

Input a value to adjust the amount of quests generated within a timeframe. The minSpacingDays (minimum days between quests) must allow the numIncidentsRange (number of quests) to fit within onDays (how many days before this block of quests ends) otherwise the game will throw errors.\nVanilla (12, 2, 3), Double Vanilla (12, 4, 1), Triple Vanilla (12, 6, 1), Daily (1, 1, 0.5).\nNote: Quests by default require a certain wealth threshold to be reached to trigger. In very low wealth starts like naked brutality or tribals its possible you might not get quests for a year or more until you hit that specific threshold.

Allows you to customise the number of slaves traders have for sale and makes it so you can request slave caravans. Also removes the Population Intent on slave trading so you always have a full selection of slaves regardless of your colony population.
Input a value to adjust the number of slaves traders have for sale\nDefault Setting 9-10.

Adds new items to the raid loot tables to add some more variety to the rewards for defeating raids. Raid loot is a stack of items given to a raider or a number of raiders to serve as a reward for deating them, this typically comes in the form of resources, medicine or drugs.
Changes the duration of all thoughts for banishing or rejecting people to expire instantly.
Changes the human FilthRate stat to 0 so they don't randomly spawn filth.

Removes the weapon stats from all Ingestible and Resource items so they can no longer be used as weapons.\nNote: If enabled mid save this will cause errors if anyone has these items equipped. You can use the mod Character Editor to move items to the inventory to fix this.

Patches every faction adding autoflee false as a tag so they will never break or flee no matter how many people die.\nThis setting is best used in combination with other mods. See the No One Ever Flees workshop page for full details.
Allows you to multiply the power generation of all Power Generating items and the Storage Capacity of all Batteries by an input value.

li.label: Vanilla Quests Expanded The Generator - Power Generation Multiplier {FSFVQEGPowerGenerationMultiplier}

li.text: Move the sliders to adjust the multiplier of all Power Generating items and the Storage Capacity of all Batteries. The value is a straight multiplier, a value of 2 will double the original while 3 will triple it.\nThe Vanilla value is 1.

Changes the stats Meditation Psyfocus Gain and Neural Heat Recovery Rate to be affected by Psychic Sensitivity. Also removes the bonuses to these stats from all GeneDef's (Genes), HediffDef's (Health Conditions), ThingDef's (Weapons and Apparel) and TraitDef's (Traits). What this means is that Psychic Sensitivity itself will provide these bonuses instead of the aforementioned things. In this way all bonuses are equally balanced, and those that didn't provide bonuses but probably should have do now. So now there is a good reason to stack your psycasters with as much Psychic Sensitivity as you can because doing so will increase their overall recovery speed. With Vanilla Psycasts Expanded the increase in Psyfocus gain will also result in your psycasters gaining XP faster.

Randy is missing the fields TraderCaravanArrival, VisitorGroup, TravelerGroup, OrbitalTraderArrival. This is no doubt so it relies on his randomness. Unfortunately the randomness tends to result in not getting these events very often. This fix adds the fields from Cassandra so these events show up regularly. This is an addition not a replacement, so the original randomness aspect is also present. If Vanilla Psycasts Expanded is loaded this tweak also adds the fields to Basilicus Bestower, as he's an exact copy of Randy except for his unique ability.

With the new rendering system clothing is rendered over a pawns head when viewed from behind. This is most noticeable with long hairstyles, instead of the hair draping over the clothing as it should it instead ends up hidden beneath making things look rather odd. This tweak patches all clothing that would pose an issue so hair is rendered over clothing allowing hair to drape over clothing as it should.

Changes power armour to be airtight if it fully covers the head or body. Meaning when the body armour and helmet are worn together it provides full Toxic Environmental Resistance. The helmets will also provide immunity to Toxic Gas.
Adds the patchleather recipe to the crafting spot allowing tribals an easier way to craft leather items.
Stops quests from hiding the bio of pawns given as rewards so you can decide if its worth doing the quest or not.

Changes a number of hediffs so they can be used in the scenario settings. For instance this allows you to create a scenario where anyone can have a chance to spawn with Metal Horrors (Anomaly DLC), as a Mime (Alpha Animals) or a Traitor (Vanilla Expanded Events).\nTo do this in the scenario editor click Add Part -> Forced Health Condition -> (The hediff you want). Set the severity (depending on the hediff severity can do different things), modify the percentage chance and set the context.

li.label: Traitor Minimum Time Range In Ticks
Traitor Maximum Time Range In Ticks

li.text: Input values to adjust the minimum and maximum time range of a Traitor reveal. The value is written in what the game calls ticks. There are 2500 ticks in one game hour and 60000 ticks in a day.\nThe Vanilla value is 120000 (2 day) to 360000 (6 days).
Allows you to customise the pathing cost of water and if the tiles are impassable.

Input a value to adjust the pathing cost of water tiles. The pathing cost is irrelevant if the terrain is set to impassable.\nPathing cost is a bit odd so you'll have to experiment with numbers. A cost of 4 gives 76% movement speed on a tile but 40 gives 25%.\nVanilla Values Shallow Water 30, Chest Deep Water 42, Deep Water 300.
Changes all items with a label name containing the word mask to the layer EyeCover so they can be worn with hats.

This is intended for games with a high ageing multiplier to ensure a steady supply of new marriage candidates. While the settings are set to 18 to 25 the actual age of people should be between 13 and 25 with it tending toward the average. The numbers can skew outside of that range when you include children and parent/child relationships. After spawning people will age at your set multiplier so you should see older pawns as time goes on provided they don't die and the game doesn't purge them.
Allows ambrosia to be researched and planted in growing zones.
Allows grass to be planted in growing zones.
Changes Glowstool, Agarilux and Timbershroom to be plantable crops. Glowstool and Agarilux have tweaked growth/yield so they are comparable to other crops.

Adds a new type of grass called Pasture Grass. It's a species of grass designed for feeding grazing animals. It lives for a long time and although it can be grown in low fertility soil it likes lushier soil.

Allows you to individually enable options that will allow plants to be plantable under roofs, allow adjacent sowing and allow planting regardless of biome. These limitations ordinarily only appear on tree or tree like plants.

li.label: Allow plants to be planted under roofs.
Allow plants to be planted regardless of biome.

li.text: Patches grass and grass like plants to give Hay when they are cut with harvest yields starting at 33% grown. Normal grass plants gives 3 Hay when fully grown which is around 50% less efficient than Haygrass. Tall Grass plants give 6 Hay when fully grown which is around 25% less efficient than Haygrass.
Changes the texture drawing of crops like rice that have messy texture placement to be nice and uniform like corn.
Allows you to pick which starting Player Factions should start the game with no completed research projects.

Removes all starting research from every Player Faction. This should work for all DLC and mods. If this is enabled then none of the following settings should be enabled.\nNote: This does not remove any research added by starting Scenarios.
Removes all starting research from the Player Colony Faction called New Arrivals which is used for industrial starting scenarios like Crashlanded.
Removes all starting research from the Player Research Expedition Faction called Research Expedition which is used for industrial starting scenarios like The Anomaly.
Removes all starting research from the Player Tribal Faction called New Tribe which is used for tribal starting scenarios like Lost Tribe.
